revised_title: Improving Defining Lines on Standards of Length with Wave-Length Rulings
tldr: Dr. A. E. H. Tutton proposes using wave-length rulings as defining lines on standards of length, such as the Imperial Standard Yard, to improve measurement accuracy. He describes a new type of defining mark called a 'Tutton location signal' and suggests its potential use in determining the number of wave-lengths of red cadmium light contained in the British yard.
